cs.DC, cs.CR, cs.DS, cs.SY, cs.NI. 

The paper deals with a distributed system and reliable broadcast, which are typically studied in the Distributed, Parallel, and Cluster Computing (cs.DC) sub-category. The paper also discusses the problem of Byzantine faults, which are commonly studied in the Cryptography and Security (cs.CR) sub-category. The algorithm presented in the paper involves message passing and coordination among processes, which are topics studied in the Data Structures and Algorithms (cs.DS) sub-category. The paper also discusses the availability of long-lived applications, which is a topic studied in the Systems and Control (cs.SY) sub-category. Finally, the paper deals with network communication and fault tolerance, which are topics studied in the Networking and Internet Architecture (cs.NI) sub-category.
